00025 #ifndef _PASSENGER_MESSAGE_READERS_WRITERS_H_
00026 #define _PASSENGER_MESSAGE_READERS_WRITERS_H_

00028 #include <boost/cstdint.hpp>
00029 #include <algorithm>
00030 #include <vector>
00031 #include <string>
00032 #include <sys/types.h>
00033 #include <cstring>
00034 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00035 #include "StaticString.h"
00036 
00037 /**
00038  * This file provides a bunch of classes for reading and writing messages in the
00039  * MessageChannel format. Unlike MessageChannel, whose operations take control over
00040  * the I/O handle and may block, these classes are like parsers and data generators.
00041  * Reader classes require the user to feed data to them. Writer classes generate a
00042  * bunch of bytes that the user can send out. These classes will never block, making
00043  * them ideal for use in evented servers.
00044  *
00045  * <h2>Reading messages</h2>
00046  * To read a single message, one must instantiate a reader object and feed network
00047  * data to it with the feed() method. This method returns the number of bytes
00048  * actually processed by the reader (i.e. the number of bytes that it has recognized
00049  * as part of the message).
00050  *
00051  * When the reader has either successfully parsed the data or encountered an error,
00052  * it will indicate so via the done() method. With hasError() one can check whether
00053  * an error was encountered or whether the reader succeeded, and with errorCode()
00054  * one can obtain the exact error reason. Not all readers support hasError() and
00055  * errorCode() because some readers can never encounter errors and some readers
00056  * only have a single reason to fail.
00057  *
00058  * When successful, the parsed message can be obtained with value(). This method
00059  * may only be called when done() is true and there is no error, otherwise the
00060  * return value is undefined.
00061  *
00062  * At this point, the reader object cannot process any more data and feed() will
00063  * always return 0. To reuse the object for processing another message, one must
00064  * reset its state by calling reset().
00065  *
00066  * The following example demonstrates how to read a continuous stream of 32-bit
00067  * integers:
00068  * @code
00069    Uint32Reader intReader;
00070    while (true) {
00071        // Read a bunch of network data...
00072        char buf[1024];
00073        ssize_t size = recv(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00074        size_t consumed = 0;
00075        
00076        // ...and process it all. We only feed data to the reader that
00077        // hasn't already been fed.
00078        while (consumed < size) {
00079            consumed += intReader.feed(buf + consumed, size - consumed);
00080            if (intReader.done()) {
00081                printf("Integer: %d\n", (int) intReader.value());
00082                // The state must be reset before the reader can be reused.
00083                intReader.reset();
00084            }
00085        }
00086    }
00087  * @endcode
00088  *
00089  * Some readers return non-primitive values in their value() methods, such as
00090  * ArrayReader and ScalarReader which return <tt>const vector<StaticString> &</tt>
00091  * and <tt>StaticString</tt>, respectively. These values are only valid until either
00092  * of the following things occur:
00093  *
00094  * - The buffer containing last the fed data has been destroyed or modified.
00095  * - The reader itself has been destroyed.
00096  *
00097  * This is because the readers try to apply copy-zero optimizations whenever
00098  * possible. For example, in case of ScalarReader, it'll check whether the data
00099  * that has been fed in the first feed() call already contains a full scalar message.
00100  * If so then it'll just return a StaticString that points to the scalar message
00101  * in the fed data; it will not copy the fed data. In this case it is important
00102  * that the buffer containing the fed data is not modified or destroyed while the
00103  * StaticString is in use.
00104  * If the first feed() call does not supply a full scalar message then it will
00105  * buffer all fed data until the buffer contains a full scalar message, and the
00106  * result will point to this buffer. Because the buffer is owned by the reader,
00107  * the result will be invalidated as soon as the reader is destroyed.
00108  */
00109 
00110 namespace Passenger {
00111 
00112 using namespace std;
00113 
00114 /**
00115  * Class for reading a 16-bit big-endian integer.
00116  */
00117 class Uint16Reader {
00118 private:
00119         uint16_t val;
00120         uint8_t  consumed;
00121         
00122 public:
00123         Uint16Reader() {
00124                 consumed = 0;
00125         }
00126         
00127         void reset() {
00128                 consumed = 0;
00129         }
00130         
00131         size_t feed(const char *data, size_t size) {
00132                 size_t locallyConsumed;
00133                 
00134                 locallyConsumed = std::min(size, sizeof(uint16_t) - consumed);
00135                 memcpy(&val + consumed, data, locallyConsumed);
00136                 consumed += locallyConsumed;
00137                 if (done()) {
00138                         val = ntohs(val);
00139                 }
00140                 return locallyConsumed;
00141         }
00142         
00143         bool done() const {
00144                 return consumed == sizeof(uint16_t);
00145         }
00146         
00147         uint16_t value() const {
00148                 return val;
00149         }
00150         
00151         void generate(void *buf, uint16_t val) const {
00152                 val = htons(val);
00153                 memcpy(buf, &val, sizeof(val));
00154         }
00155 };
00156 
00157 /**
00158  * Class for reading a 32-bit big-endian integer.
00159  */
00160 class Uint32Reader {
00161 private:
00162         uint32_t val;
00163         uint8_t  consumed;
00164         
00165 public:
00166         Uint32Reader() {
00167                 consumed = 0;
00168         }
00169         
00170         void reset() {
00171                 consumed = 0;
00172         }
00173         
00174         size_t feed(const char *data, size_t size) {
00175                 size_t locallyConsumed;
00176                 
00177                 locallyConsumed = std::min(size, sizeof(uint32_t) - consumed);
00178                 memcpy(&val + consumed, data, locallyConsumed);
00179                 consumed += locallyConsumed;
00180                 if (done()) {
00181                         val = ntohl(val);
00182                 }
00183                 return locallyConsumed;
00184         }
00185         
00186         bool done() const {
00187                 return consumed == sizeof(uint32_t);
00188         }
00189         
00190         uint32_t value() const {
00191                 return val;
00192         }
00193 };
00194 
00195 /**
00196  * Class for reading a an array message.
00197  */
00198 class ArrayReader {
00199 public:
00200         enum Error {
00201                 TOO_LARGE
00202         };
00203         
00204 private:
00205         enum State {
00206                 READING_HEADER,
00207                 READING_BODY,
00208                 DONE,
00209                 ERROR
00210         };
00211         
00212         uint16_t toReserve;
00213         uint16_t maxSize;
00214         Uint16Reader headerReader;
00215         uint8_t state;
00216         uint8_t error;
00217         string buffer;
00218         vector<StaticString> result;
00219         
00220         void parseBody(const char *data, size_t size) {
00221                 const char *start = data;
00222                 const char *terminator;
00223                 size_t rest = size;
00224                 
00225                 while ((terminator = (const char *) memchr(start, '\0', rest)) != NULL) {
00226                         size_t len = terminator - start;
00227                         result.push_back(StaticString(start, len));
00228                         start = terminator + 1;
00229                         rest = size - (start - data);
00230                 }
00231         }
00232         
00233 public:
00234         ArrayReader() {
00235                 state = READING_HEADER;
00236                 toReserve = 0;
00237                 maxSize = 0;
00238         }
00239         
00240         void reserve(uint16_t size) {
00241                 toReserve = size;
00242                 result.reserve(size);
00243         }
00244         
00245         void setMaxSize(uint16_t size) {
00246                 maxSize = size;
00247         }
00248         
00249         void reset() {
00250                 state = READING_HEADER;
00251                 headerReader.reset();
00252                 buffer.clear();
00253                 result.clear();
00254                 if (toReserve > 0) {
00255                         result.reserve(toReserve);
00256                 }
00257         }
00258         
00259         size_t feed(const char *data, size_t size) {
00260                 size_t consumed = 0;
00261                 
00262                 while (consumed < size && !done()) {
00263                         const char *current = data + consumed;
00264                         size_t rest = size - consumed;
00265                         
00266                         switch (state) {
00267                         case READING_HEADER:
00268                                 consumed += headerReader.feed(current, rest);
00269                                 if (headerReader.done()) {
00270                                         if (maxSize > 0 && headerReader.value() > maxSize) {
00271                                                 state = ERROR;
00272                                                 error = TOO_LARGE;
00273                                         } else {
00274                                                 state = READING_BODY;
00275                                         }
00276                                 }
00277                                 break;
00278                         case READING_BODY:
00279                                 if (buffer.empty() && rest >= headerReader.value()) {
00280                                         parseBody(current, headerReader.value());
00281                                         state = DONE;
00282                                         consumed += headerReader.value();
00283                                 } else {
00284                                         size_t toConsume = std::min(rest,
00285                                                 headerReader.value() - buffer.size());
00286                                         if (buffer.capacity() < headerReader.value()) {
00287                                                 buffer.reserve(headerReader.value());
00288                                         }
00289                                         buffer.append(current, toConsume);
00290                                         consumed += toConsume;
00291                                         if (buffer.size() == headerReader.value()) {
00292                                                 parseBody(buffer.data(), buffer.size());
00293                                                 state = DONE;
00294                                         }
00295                                 }
00296                                 break;
00297                         default:
00298                                 // Never reached.
00299                                 abort();
00300                         }
00301                 }
00302                 return consumed;
00303         }
00304         
00305         bool done() const {
00306                 return state == DONE || state == ERROR;
00307         }
00308         
00309         bool hasError() const {
00310                 return state == ERROR;
00311         }
00312         
00313         Error errorCode() const {
00314                 return (Error) error;
00315         }
00316         
00317         const vector<StaticString> &value() const {
00318                 return result;
00319         }
00320 };
00321 
00322 /**
00323  * Class for reading a scalar message.
00324  */
00325 class ScalarReader {
00326 public:
00327         enum Error {
00328                 TOO_LARGE
00329         };
00330         
00331 private:
00332         enum State {
00333                 READING_HEADER,
00334                 READING_BODY,
00335                 DONE,
00336                 ERROR
00337         };
00338         
00339         uint8_t state;
00340         uint8_t error;
00341         uint32_t maxSize;
00342         Uint32Reader headerReader;
00343         string buffer;
00344         StaticString result;
00345         
00346 public:
00347         ScalarReader(uint32_t maxSize = 0) {
00348                 state = READING_HEADER;
00349                 this->maxSize = maxSize;
00350         }
00351         
00352         void reset() {
00353                 state = READING_HEADER;
00354                 headerReader.reset();
00355                 buffer.clear();
00356         }
00357         
00358         size_t feed(const char *data, size_t size) {
00359                 size_t consumed = 0;
00360                 
00361                 while (consumed < size && !done()) {
00362                         const char *current = data + consumed;
00363                         size_t rest = size - consumed;
00364                         
00365                         switch (state) {
00366                         case READING_HEADER:
00367                                 consumed += headerReader.feed(current, rest);
00368                                 if (headerReader.done()) {
00369                                         if (maxSize > 0 && headerReader.value() > maxSize) {
00370                                                 state = ERROR;
00371                                                 error = TOO_LARGE;
00372                                         } else {
00373                                                 state = READING_BODY;
00374                                         }
00375                                 }
00376                                 break;
00377                         case READING_BODY:
00378                                 if (buffer.empty() && rest >= headerReader.value()) {
00379                                         result = StaticString(current, headerReader.value());
00380                                         state = DONE;
00381                                         consumed += headerReader.value();
00382                                 } else {
00383                                         size_t toConsume = std::min(rest,
00384                                                 headerReader.value() - buffer.size());
00385                                         if (buffer.capacity() < headerReader.value()) {
00386                                                 buffer.reserve(headerReader.value());
00387                                         }
00388                                         buffer.append(current, toConsume);
00389                                         consumed += toConsume;
00390                                         if (buffer.size() == headerReader.value()) {
00391                                                 result = StaticString(buffer);
00392                                                 state = DONE;
00393                                         }
00394                                 }
00395                                 break;
00396                         default:
00397                                 // Never reached.
00398                                 abort();
00399                         };
00400                 }
00401                 return consumed;
00402         }
00403         
00404         bool done() const {
00405                 return state == DONE || state == ERROR;
00406         }
00407         
00408         bool hasError() const {
00409                 return state == ERROR;
00410         }
00411         
00412         Error errorCode() const {
00413                 return (Error) error;
00414         }
00415         
00416         StaticString value() const {
00417                 return result;
00418         }
00419 };
00420 
00421 } // namespace Passenger
